perturbation.original_text:
Consideration. As consideration for Celebrity's services under this Agreement, HDS agrees as follows: 

A. In-kind Payment: HDS will provide Celebrity with a one (1) year complimentary supply (i.e., at least 365 
caplets) of Clotamin product during the Term. 

B. Cash Payment: 

(1) HDS will provide payment of Fifty Thousand and NO/100 Dollars ($50,000) made payable to Celebrity's 
agent. CSE, as follows 

$10,000
Within ten (10) days of the parties execution of this Agreement 
$15,000
Within 60 days of the parties execution of this agreement 
$25,000*
Ten (10) days prior to the Production Session 

[*Should Company decide not to conduct the Production Session, then the $25,000 allocated for said 
Production Session ("Production Fee") will not be owed to Celebrity and notice should be given to 
CSE as soon as reasonably known by Company if Company does not intend to conduct the 
Production Session. However, if Company schedules the Production Session, then said Production 
Fee is non-refundable regardless if the Production Session occurs. ] 

(a) CSE, shall invoice HDS for these fees and HDS shall pay such invoice within ten (10) business days 
following receipt of the CSE invoice. 

(b) Payments shall be made to CSE and delivered to 600 Galleria Parkway, Suite 1900, Atlanta, Georgia 
30339. 

(2) If HDS desires to add an additional market or state to the Markets for the Commercial to air during the 
Term, then HOS will pay Celebrity Five Thousand and NO/100 Dollars ($5,000) for said additional 
state/market, and the parties will amend the Agreement to add the additional state/market accordingly.
perturbation.changed_text:
Consideration. As consideration for Celebrity's services under this Agreement, HDS agrees as follows: 

A. In-kind Payment: HDS will provide Celebrity with a complimentary supply of Clotamin product during the Term.

B. Cash Payment: HDS will provide payment made payable to Celebrity's agent, CSE, as agreed in a separate addendum.
perturbation.explanation: The specific payment schedule and amounts are removed, including details about the in-kind payment (number of caplets). The removal of the cash payment schedule creates uncertainty about when and how much Celebrity will be paid. Referencing an 'addendum' implies another document defines the cash payment, but if this document doesn't exist or conflicts, it introduces contradiction and ambiguity. The removal of the number of caplets leaves the amount of in-kind payment undefined and open to interpretation.

perturbation.original_text:
Review, Approval, and Ownership of Advertising. All HDS' uses of Celebrity Attributes in connection with the 
Commercial and/or press releases shall be subject to the prior written approval of Celebrity via his agent, CSE. Said 
written approval must be given within five (5) business days of CSE's receipt or said usage shall be deemed 
unapproved. Any such usage featuring Celebrity in the Commercial and/or press releases shall be and remain the 
property of HDS; however, HDS shall have the right to use said Commercial and/or press releases solely as outlined in 
Paragraph 3 and only during the Term. Celebrity may use said materials in whole or in part solely for the purpose of 
presenting Celebrity's work in Celebrity's personal portfolio, website or otherwise and/or on Celebrity's agent's 
website. Such usage may not be sold or transferred.
perturbation.changed_text: Review, Approval, and Ownership of Advertising. All HDS' uses of Celebrity Attributes in connection with the Commercial and/or press releases shall be subject to the approval process. Any such usage featuring Celebrity in the Commercial and/or press releases shall be and remain the property of HDS; however, HDS shall have the right to use said Commercial and/or press releases solely as outlined in Paragraph 3 and only during the Term. Celebrity may use said materials in whole or in part solely for the purpose of presenting Celebrity's work in Celebrity's personal portfolio, website or otherwise and/or on Celebrity's agent's website. Such usage may not be sold or transferred.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specification of 'prior written approval of Celebrity via his agent, CSE' and replacing it with 'approval process,' the exact procedure for approval is made vague. The defined time frame of 5 business days for approval is omitted. This omission creates ambiguity about who needs to approve the advertising, what form the approval must take, and the consequences of failing to obtain approval. This contradicts the original detailed approval process.

perturbation.original_text:
Insurance. HDS agrees to provide and maintain at its own expense, the following insurance coverages: 

A. Commercial General Liability coverage of product liability with limits no less than $1,000,000 per occurrence 
and $2,000,000 aggregate. 

B. Umbrella / Excess Liability coverage inclusive of product liability with limits not less than $5,000,000 per 
occurrence and aggregate. 

C. Media Liability insurance with limits not less than $2,000,000 per occurrence and aggregate.  

The Celebrity shall be named as an additional insured on coverages A, B and C. Celebrity is afforded waiver of 
subrogation on coverages A, B and C. All policies listed under A, B and C should have a thirty (30) day notice of 
cancellation provision or endorsement. HDS will provide Celebrity’s agent, CSE, with a certificate of insurance 
within five (5) days of its request for same.
perturbation.changed_text: Insurance. HDS agrees to provide and maintain at its own expense, insurance coverages as generally required for similar endorsement agreements. The Celebrity shall be named as an additional insured. HDS will provide Celebrity’s agent, CSE, with a certificate of insurance upon request.
perturbation.explanation: The specific types of insurance (Commercial General Liability, Umbrella/Excess Liability, Media Liability) and their coverage limits are removed. The thirty (30) day notice of cancellation provision, Celebrity's afforded waiver of subrogation, and the detailed specification of insurance types create uncertainty about the level of insurance HDS must maintain. Removing the five (5) days of its request for same creates a contradiction because there is no time frame.
